[Page Title: Vintage Lounge - Charleston, SC - Fine Wine | Cocktails | Cheese & Charcuterie]

THE MOST BEAUTIFULLY DESIGNED BAR IN SOUTH CAROLINA

-
Architectural Digest 
A DESTINATION

Named ‚ÄúThe Most Beautifully Designed Bar in South Carolina‚Äù by, Vintage Lounge is an upscale Charleston bar offering the finest selection of drinks. We feature more than twenty wines by-the-glass and a bottle list with over 200 selections, sure to satisfy any palate. Our offerings focus on small production wines typical of place and varietal character, and feature producers who believe in a hands-off approach to making wine. Many of our wines are certified organic or practice viticulture organically, biodynamically, or in a natural and respectful way.
Architectural Digest 
In addition to our expansive wine selection, we pride ourselves in offering proper cocktails - both classic and original creations - and a small selection of local craft beer in can form. Our beverage offerings are the perfect compliment to our curated selection of specialty cheeses and charcuterie to complete Charleston, SC‚Äôs most intimate night out!

Vintage Lounge is located on Upper King Street in a beautifully renovated historic building. In addition to our award winning interiors, we feature a¬†spacious outdoor patio and bar so that you and your guests can take in all that Charleston has to offer. Vintage Lounge is without question Charleston‚Äôs best upscale bar for both date night & group outings!

We are looking for a couple of people to join our team! 

Do you enjoy high volume, fast-paced work in an upscale environment? 

Whether you are a seasoned veteran or a newcomer to the industry, we want to talk to you! 

Please send your resume to info@vintagechs.com and let us know why you think Vintage Lounge is the right place for you.

The French 75

The drink dates to World War I, and an early form was created in 1915 at the New York Bar in Paris‚Äîlater Harry's New York Bar‚Äîby barman Harry MacElhone. The combination was said to have such a kick that it felt like being shelled with the powerful French 75mm field gun.
